{"step_by_step_thinking": "Bennett angle is a measurement used in dentistry to describe the angle which the path of the balancing side condyle makes with the sagittal plane during lateral excursion. It is not related to the sagittal condylar path or the Frankfort plane. The measurement is typically obtained using a face bow, but this is not the definition of the Bennett angle itself. Therefore, the correct answer is B.", "answer_choice": "B"}
